SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am52
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am52.model.playingBoards

Class BoardSlot

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am52.model.playingBoards.BoardSlot
All Implemented Interfaces:
BoardSlotInfo, Serializable
public class BoardSlot extends Object implements Serializable, BoardSlotInfo
Immutable class that represents the position of a slot in the Playing board. Every slot has its horizontal and vertical coordinates, only slots with both coordinates odd or both even are valid. The slot with coordinates (0,0) is the root slot, because it has a special meaning in Playing board (only the starter card can be placed on the root slot).
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • validateCoords

      public static boolean validateCoords(int horiz, int vert)
      The coordinates of a valid board slot must be:
      • Both 'horiz' and 'vert' with odd values, or
      • Both 'horiz' and 'vert' with even values.
      The slot at (h=0, v=0) is the root of the playing board and only the starter card can be placed on that slot.
      Parameters:
      horiz - The horizontal coordinate of the slot.
      vert - The vertical coordinate of the slot.
      Returns:
      True if the coordinates of the slot represent a valid coordinate pair for a slot of the playing board.

    • isRootSlot

      public boolean isRootSlot()
      The root slot is the slot with both horizontal and vertical coordinates equal to zero. This is a special slot position, because only the starter card can be placed on the root slot.
      Returns:
      True if the specified slot is the root slot, i.e. with coordinates (0,0).
